description:
The condition of America’s voting systems is well known: only two major vendors remain with solutions that are black box and proprietary, and there is little assurance of accuracy, transparency, trust, or security. The TrustTheVote Project is a groundbreaking effort comprised of four big ideas:    • Elections systems should be publicly owned, open source, and transparent;
   • The only way to achieve accuracy, transparency, trust, and security is to engage stakeholders in a community effort to drive the requirements and specifications for a system framework that can be tailored to each jurisdiction;
   • Such a system must be designed and built as a series of independent “lightweight” single-purpose components and not a single monolithic system; and
   • Such a system, despite the capabilities of digital innovation, must produce a paper record of the cast ballot and transparent audit loops for the entire process.

This session provides an overview of an imperative public digital works project: an established effort to re-invent how America votes in a digital democracy. Its not online voting, but it is rebuilding America’s voting systems infrastructure into an open source, publicly owned platform. It is an imperative project for us all, because how America votes has become just as important as who America votes for.
title: Reinventing How America Votes Through Open Source Solutions
